Package org.fluentjdbc

Interface DatabaseListableQueryBuilder

  • All Known Implementing Classes:
    DatabaseJoinedQueryBuilder, DatabaseTableQueryBuilder
    public interface DatabaseListableQueryBuilder
    Interface to execute terminal operations for SELECT-statements. Usage: 
     table.where...().list(connection, row -> row.getUUID("column"));
 table.where...().single(connection, row -> row.getLocalDate("column"));

    • Method Summary

      All Methods Instance Methods Abstract Methods Default Methods 
      Modifier and Type Method Description
      void forEach​(Connection connection, DatabaseResult.RowConsumer consumer)
      Executes the SELECT * FROM ... statement and calls back to DatabaseResult.RowConsumer for each returned row
      int getCount​(Connection connection)
      Executes SELECT count(*) FROM ... on the query and returns the result
      <T> List<T> list​(Connection connection, DatabaseResult.RowMapper<T> mapper)
      Execute the query and map each return value over the DatabaseResult.RowMapper function to return a list.
      default List<Long> listLongs​(Connection connection, String fieldName)
      Executes SELECT count(*) FROM ... on the query and returns the result
      default List<String> listStrings​(Connection connection, String fieldName)
      Executes SELECT count(*) FROM ... on the query and returns the result
      DatabaseListableQueryBuilder orderBy​(String orderByClause)  
      <T> Stream<T> stream​(Connection connection, DatabaseResult.RowMapper<T> mapper)
      Execute the query and map each return value over the DatabaseResult.RowMapper function to return a stream.

    • Method Detail

      • orderBy

        DatabaseListableQueryBuilder orderBy​(String orderByClause)

      • stream

        <T> Stream<T> stream​(Connection connection,
                     DatabaseResult.RowMapper<T> mapper)
        Execute the query and map each return value over the DatabaseResult.RowMapper function to return a stream. Example: 
             table.where("status", status).stream(connection, row -> row.getInstant("created_at"))

      • list

        <T> List<T> list​(Connection connection,
                 DatabaseResult.RowMapper<T> mapper)
        Execute the query and map each return value over the DatabaseResult.RowMapper function to return a list. Example: 
             List<Instant> creationTimes = table.where("status", status).list(row -> row.getInstant("created_at"))

      • forEach

        void forEach​(Connection connection,
             DatabaseResult.RowConsumer consumer)
        Executes the SELECT * FROM ... statement and calls back to DatabaseResult.RowConsumer for each returned row

        Executes SELECT count(*) FROM ... on the query and returns the result
